name: Foxhills of Shanklin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We so needed to get away to somewhere quiet and welcoming. We could not have made a better choice. From the moment when we drove into the car park to the moment we left Foxhills we were treated like royalty by James and Paula. Our suite was spotless and comfortable, our breakfast was delicious and varied, the spa was a treat. The attention to detail was amazing and the infomation to help us enjoy the island was very informative. We would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this wonderful place. Thank you so much, Paula and James for making our stay one to remember for all the right reasons.
reviews.title: Perfect for our much needed break!

reviews.text: I stayed with my parents last week for 5 days. Hotel was nice, in a nice classic building around 100 years old (so many B&Bs looked really ugly in more modern buildings), 5 mins walk from Shanklin village. My room was very nice and spacious and all seem to have tea making facilities and a good choice of teas/hot chocolate etc. My parents room was not quite as nicely decorated but very comfortable. And the hosts were extremely friendly and really, you couldn't ask for more in terms of help and friendliness.
reviews.title: difficult to do better

reviews.text: The hotel has a very nice lounge that my father and I enjoyed playing scrabble in. Shame about the weather though which rained incessantly, meaning we were in the B&B for more time than usual. Thus we ate in 2 nights due to too much rain. The first night we had very nice sandwiches and the 2nd night I requested (not on the menu) if Paula might do me a salad and I got the most delicious prawn salad that was definitely the best meal I'd had on the island!!
reviews.title: Great stay again!

reviews.text: Now that's service for you.
reviews.title: Very Friendly, Good value and Excellent Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other thing I noticed was that many other guests (nice and friendly people) had been there several times which shows that it's consistently good.
reviews.title: Service with a smile

reviews.text: Lovely B&B in a great location. Clean rooms, great breakfast, super owner who gave us great advice on what to do. Follow their island guide for a lovely day out. 10 mins walk in to Shanklin for loads of eateries. Peaceful time away.
reviews.title: Look no further

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it has a great pleasure again to stay, the rooms are very clean & bright the owner is very helpful & polite would highly recommend a stay here we will use this hotel again even if its just to sit back & relax
reviews.title: relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at Foxhills after 3 1/2 hour journey to be greeted by James, our host, with a fresh cup of coffee and tea. We were shown up to our room which was spotless. The bed was big and very comfortable and we had a separate dressing room and a bathroom with bath/shower. Breakfast was from 8.30 till9.30 with a large choice. Full English was great!
reviews.title: Lovely Spring Break
Best hotel on the Island
reviews.text: There was onsite parking and we used our car each day to travel the Island. James was really helpful with his local knowledge. In the evening we walked into Shanklin old town, which only took7-8 minutes, to eat and drink. There was plenty of choice, the local beer was good and prices for food very reasonable. We had an excellent stay and would recommend Foxhills to anyone. Forgot to mention the spa, it's very relaxing after a day out.
We stayed for a long weekend and was late due to the traffic, but when we arrived we were met with a smile.
reviews.title: Bewertung

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Truly wonderful breakfast – very comprehensive choice of tempting things such as Paula’s mum’s whisky marmalade. Free Wifi. It was very obvious right from the start that James and Paula wanted our stay to be perfect. They are warm and interesting hosts. Nothing too much trouble. Highly recommended
reviews.title: Warm hospitality and fantastic breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the 6th or 7th time we have stayed here. The hotel is excellently situtated just a 3 minute walk from Shanklin Old Village. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the breakfasts are large with a great choice of food. The bedrooms are well equipped and extremely comfortable. The hotel has a whirlpool spa which is great for relaxing in after a day out enjoying yourself. The hotel is in a nice quite leafy location and has on site free car parking plus a nice lttle garden and patio if you would like to sit outside and have a glass of wine. James and Paula are the ideal hosts, they are friendly and approachable, nothing and I mean nothing is to much trouble for them.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for a Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a short break, Jame's was there to greet us, fantastic service all round, if you get the chance jump in the Spa which is totally free... unfortunately we never got to meet Paula but I'm sure she was there keeping James on his toes.... fantastic host highly recommended...
reviews.title: Other reviews say it all Five star's

reviews.text: I stayed at foxhills for a long weekend with my elderly mother in august.
reviews.title: brilliant b and b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived we were greeted by James(who is the perfect host) and served with a pot of tea and home made chocolates on the patio,whilst he took our cases to our room,such a lovely gesture.
reviews.title: Finest..with a personal touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second year running when we have been the first guests at Foxhills when it opened for the season on 1st March. It’s simply the best place on the Island with great facilities and brilliant service. We took advantage of the March deal where you get your car ferry ticket free with a three-night stay. For a place with a 5 Star Gold ranking, the value for money is amazing. We love the whirlpool spa, especially as we can close the door and have it private to ourselves. We ate at the Village Inn in the old bit of Shanklin which was really good. We also had a great pasta evening at Mamma Mias which was also good value. On the first night, Paula made us some great snacks which we had in our room. We like the new flat-screen, freeview TVs with the built in DVD. Thanks James, thanks Paula. See you again soon!
reviews.title: Heaven !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival James treated us like friends with a warm welcome and a hot drink. He was eager to show us the spa bath and the in-room facilities straight away, all of which were spotlessly clean and well appointed. Unfortunately our stay as cut short and we had to return to the mainland prematurely. It was refreshing to see a B&B so well kept and with lots of home-made touches which have earned James and Paula such high praise in the other reviews.
reviews.title: Short but sweet

reviews.text: Foxhills seems to be the only place that seems to understand the needs of business people visiting the Island.
reviews.title: Superb service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of messed-up travel arrangements, I wasn’t able to check in til after 11pm. No problem for James who then made me some sandwiches which went down well with a half-bottle of Rioja! Then I needed to be up and about early. Again, no problem. A proper full English at 6:45 in the morning. And free WiFi. And the room-rate is really good too.
reviews.title: Perfect Service

reviews.text: We had a short stay in September and from the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were made to feel so welcome and at home. Upon arrival we were shown around and given tea and home made chocolates in the beautiful, cosy lounge. James was always so friendly and helpful and you just felt as if nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: wonderful welcome , good rooms and a great breakfast

aka: Foxhills Of Shanklin Isle Of Wight
description: An award winning Five Star Gold Guest Accommodation with Spa and Health and Beauty Treatments in Shanklin on the Isle of Wight in easy reach of the town, the Old Village, the beach and the downs. Perfect for a relaxing break.
